{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is a marathon runner who has pain in the anteromedial tibia during regular walking or jogging for long hours. The X-ray is normal, but the doctor has ordered a bone scan. This suggests that the doctor is looking for a condition that might not show up on an X-ray but could be detected with a bone scan. A Jones fracture and a Lisfranc fracture are specific types of fractures that would likely show up on an X-ray. A Nutcracker is not a medical condition related to bone injuries. Shin splints, also known as medial tibial stress syndrome, is a condition common in runners that causes pain along the inner edge of the shinbone (tibia). Shin splints often don't show up on X-rays but can be detected with a bone scan.", "answer_choice": "B"}
